title: EU Green Week 2025: Circular solutions for a competitive Europe
summary: Join online now, the EU’s largest annual environmental conference exploring how Europe can shift to more circular and sustainable models.

title: VIDEO: Trash is cash: ‘urban mining’ for strategic metals in your neighbourhood
summary: In this episode of 'The Road to Green' Euronews travels to Belgium and Denmark to explore innovative projects that help to reduce our dependence on raw materials, thanks to the circular economy.

title: Vilnius, the European Green Capital bringing citizens to the forefront
summary: As the European Green Capital 2025, Vilnius has launched a series of sustainability projects, from student challenges to eco-conscious art installations and tree planting, setting an example in green governance and community-driven environmental action.

title: Stockholm unveils ambitious climate action plan for 2030 – setting a bold example as the first European Green Capital awarded in 2010
summary: The city of Stockholm has officially launched its Environment Programme and Climate Action Plan 2030, laying out a comprehensive roadmap to become fossil-free, circular and climate-positive by 2040.

title: Nature-based solutions increase nature and human wellbeing
summary: City Blues project helps cities adapt to climate change with nature-based solutions for urban flooding and storm water management.

title: Celebrate 33 years of protecting the EU’s nature and join a Bioblitz near you
summary: European Natura 2000 Day is celebrated every year on 21 May. It marks the inception, 33 years ago, of a revolutionary approach to nature conservation in the EU – a large network of protected nature that maintains opportunities for economic and recreational development.

title: Discover the applicant cities of the 2027 European Green Capital and Green Leaf Awards
summary: For the 15th time, the European Commission is looking for the next winners of the European Green Capital and European Green Leaf Awards. In our challenging times, cities are at the forefront of sustainable action. 20 cities have entered the competition for the 2027 titles.

title: New Practical Guides - EU Ecolabel shows the way to green procurement of paper products
summary: Public buyers can make a step towards green procurement of paper products. The two newly released Practical guides for the use of the EU Ecolabel in the green public procurement of graphic paper, and of tissue paper and tissue products are here to help.

title: Travelling by train to Europe’s nature treasures
summary: As a “slow-travel” influencer, Eveline encourages people to learn more about sustainability and find unique experiences across Europe by taking a train. Ahead of Natura2000 Day, DG Environment partnered with her and she picked 5 protected areas that everyone should visit.

title: Commission adopts a user-friendly planning tool to support Member States in implementing the Nature Restoration Regulation
summary: The European Commission has adopted an Implementing Regulation that establishes a uniform format for national restoration plans under the Nature Restoration Regulation, which entered into force in August 2024.

title: World Water Day: Joint Statement by Borrell and Sinkevičius
summary: The health and prosperity of people and the planet rely on the stability of the global water cycle.

title: EU 2030 climate and environmental targets within reach
summary: The Commission's mid-term review of the 8th Environment Action Programme, released Wednesday, confirms that the goals are achievable.

title: Revision of EU Ecolabel criteria for textile  products
summary: The criteria for the Textile product group is under revision. The first multistakeholder working group to revise the criteria is scheduled between the 18th and 19th of March.

title: Revision of EU Ecolabel criteria for cleaning products
summary: The criteria for the Detergents product group is under revision. The first multistakeholder working group to revise the criteria is scheduled between the 12 th and 13 th of March.

title: Drinking water to become safer thanks to new EU-wide hygiene standards
summary: The Commission has adopted new minimum hygiene standards for products that will make water safer to drink.

title: Commission welcomes provisional agreement for more sustainable, repairable and circular products
summary: The Commission welcomes the provisional agreement reached last night between the European Parliament and the Council on the Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation.

title: Commission welcomes political agreement on protecting the environment through criminal law
summary: The European Commission welcomes the provisional agreement reached today between the European Parliament and the Council on the protection of the environment through criminal law.

title: Commission welcomes political agreement on stronger control of exports of waste
summary: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached last night between the European Parliament and the Council on waste shipments.

title: New measures to reduce microplastic pollution from plastic pellets
summary: Today, the Commission is proposing measures to prevent microplastic pollution from the unintentional release of plastic pellets.
